Detailed Description

seDRMMeshFaceTable wraps the DRM <Mesh_Face_Table> class.

Author:
Warren Macchi
Version:
Revision: 1.8
See also:
seDRMBase

Member Function Documentation

virtual void sedris::seDRMMeshFaceTable::putMeshFaceTableData ( SE_Integer_Positive  start_face,
SE_Integer_Positive  number_faces,
const SE_Integer_Unsigned *  mesh_face_table_data,
const SE_Integer_Unsigned *  adjacent_face_table_data = NULL 
) [virtual]

Set Mesh Face Table data.

See the seHelperMeshFaceTable class for an easier interface for accessing mesh face table data.

The number_faces parameter indicates the number of entries in the array mesh_face_table_data (and adjacent_face_table_data if required).

Note:
The sum of start_face and number_faces must not be greater than the number of faces indicated in the mesh_face_count field of the <Mesh Face Table> object.

If the adjacent_face_table_present field of the <Mesh Face Table> object is SE_TRUE, then adjacent_face_table_data must not be NULL.

The user is responsible for allocating/deallocating the data memory.

See also:
seHelperMeshFaceTable

virtual void sedris::seDRMMeshFaceTable::getMeshFaceTableData ( SE_Integer_Positive  start_face,
SE_Integer_Positive  number_faces,
SE_Integer_Unsigned *  mesh_face_table_data,
SE_Integer_Unsigned *  adjacent_face_table_data = NULL 
) [virtual]

Get Mesh Face Table data.

See the seHelperMeshFaceTable class for an easier interface for accessing mesh face table data.

The number_faces parameter indicates the number of entries in the array mesh_face_table_data (and adjacent_face_table_data if required).

Note:
The sum of start_face and number_faces must not be greater than the number of faces indicated in the mesh_face_count field of the <Mesh Face Table> object.

The user is responsible for allocating/deallocating the data memory.

See also:
seHelperMeshFaceTable

virtual SE_DRM_Class sedris::seDRMMeshFaceTable::getClassType (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Gets the DRM class type this object can reference (mostly internal use).

Warning:
Don't confuse with getDRMClass(), which is dependent on the actual type held by this DRM class object reference.
Returns:
SE_CLS_DRM_MESH_FACE_TABLE
